query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
1 Come l’augello, intra l’amate fronde, 2 posato al nido de’ suoi dolci nati 3 la notte che le cose ci nasconde,
4 che, per veder li aspetti disïati 5 e per trovar lo cibo onde li pasca, 6 in che gravi labor li sono aggrati,
7 previene il tempo in su aperta frasca, 8 e con ardente affetto il sole aspetta, 9 fiso guardando pur che l’alba nasca;
10 così la donna mïa stava eretta 11 e attenta, rivolta inver’ la plaga 12 sotto la quale il sol mostra men fretta:
13 sì che, veggendola io sospesa e vaga, 14 fecimi qual è quei che disïando 15 altro vorria, e sperando s’appaga.
query.result:
**English:**
1 Like the bird, among the beloved leaves, 2 perched at the nest of its sweet offspring, 3 on the night that hides things from us,
4 that, in order to see their desired faces 5 and to find the food with which to feed them, 6 in which heavy labors are pleasing to it,
7 anticipates the time on an open branch, 8 and with ardent affection awaits the sun, 9 intently watching for the dawn to break;
10 thus my lady stood erect 11 and attentive, turned towards the region 12 under which the sun shows less haste:
13 so that, seeing her suspended and eager, 14 I became like one who, desiring 15 something else, is satisfied by hoping.
**Sanskrit:**
1 Yathā pakṣī, priyāṇi patrāṇi antarā, 2 svānām madhurāṇāṃ santānānāṃ nīḍe niviṣṭaḥ, 3 rātrau yā vastuṣu naḥ āvaraṇam karoti,
4 yā, tāsāṃ abhilāṣitānām mūrtaye dṛṣṭum 5 tathā āhāram prāptum yena tāḥ poṣayet, 6 yasmin gurutaraḥ śramaḥ asyai priyaḥ asti,
7 kāle pūrvam eva udyate vikasitāyām śākhāyām, 8 caṇḍena snehena sūryam abhīkṣate, 9 niścitam avalokayantī eva yāvat prabhātaṃ jāyate;
10 tathā mama strī sthitā āsīt utthitā 11 ca apekṣamāṇā, parāvṛttā tasya diśaḥ abhimukham 12 yasmin adhasthāt sūryaḥ mandam gatiṃ darśayati:
13 tām aham dṛṣṭvā viṣṇannām ca ākulām ca, 14 abhūvam yathā saḥ yaḥ abhilāṣayann 15 anyat icchati, ca āśayann santuṣṭaḥ bhavati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
22 Pariemi che ’l suo viso ardesse tutto, 23 e li occhi avea di letizia sì pieni, 24 che passarmen convien sanza costrutto.
query.result:
**English:**
22 It seemed to me that his face was all aflame, 23 and his eyes were so full of joy, 24 that I must pass on without describing them.
**Sanskrit:**
22 Pratīyate me yathā tasya vaktram sarvam dīpyate sma, 23 ca akṣīṇi tasya ānandena tathā pūrṇe āstām, 24 yathā tatra viṣaye vinā viṣayasaṃpraptyā vyutthātum na śakyate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
25 Quale ne’ plenilunïi sereni 26 Trivïa ride tra le ninfe etterne 27 che dipingon lo ciel per tutti i seni,
28 vid’ i’ sopra migliaia di lucerne 29 un sol che tutte quante l’accendea, 30 come fa ’l nostro le viste superne;
31 e per la viva luce trasparea 32 la lucente sustanza tanto chiara 33 nel viso mio, che non la sostenea.
query.result:
**English:**
25 Like Trivia under the serene full moons 26 smiles among the eternal nymphs 27 who paint the sky in all its parts,
28 above I saw thousands of lights 29 a sun that kindled all of them, 30 as ours kindles the highest stars;
31 and through the living light shone forth 32 the shining substance so bright 33 in my face that I could not bear it.
**Sanskrit:**
25 Yathā pūrṇacandrānām praśāntānām 26 Triviyā nṛtyati nityanimfaiḥ saha 27 Yāḥ sarvabhāgeṣu nabhaḥ rañjayanti,
28 Tathāhaṃ upari adṛkṣam sahasraśaḥ pradipān 29 Ekam sūryam yaḥ sarvān prakāśayati sma, 30 Yathā asmākam sūryaḥ uttamān darśanān prakāśayati;
31 Tataḥ jīvanaprakāśāt prakāśate sma 32 Prakāśamānasattvaṃ tāvaduttamaṃ 33 Mama mukhe, yad aham tat na śaknomi sahitum.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
34 Oh Bëatrice, dolce guida e cara! 35 Ella mi disse: «Quel che ti sobranza 36 è virtù da cui nulla si ripara.
query.result:
**English:**
34 O Beatrice, sweet and dear guide! 35 She said to me: "That which overwhelms you 36 is a power from which nothing can protect itself.
**Sanskrit:**
34 He Bēātrīcē, madhura pr̥ṣṭhatā priyā ca! 35 Sā ahaṃ: "Yattvāṃ atiriktēna paripīḍyase 36 tatparākramaḥ asti yasmāt kiṃcidapi na pratiraddhyatē.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
37 Quivi è la sapïenza e la possanza 38 ch’aprì le strade tra ’l cielo e la terra, 39 onde fu già sì lunga disïanza».
query.result:
**English:**
37 Here is the wisdom and the power 38 that opened the roads between heaven and earth, 39 where there was once such a long estrangement.
**Sanskrit:**
37 Atraiva jñānam ca śaktica ca 38 Yābhyāṃ svarlokasya pṛthivyāśca madhye mārgaḥ prakāśitaḥ, 39 Yatra pūrvaṃ tathāvidhaḥ viyogaḥ āsīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
40 Come foco di nube si diserra 41 per dilatarsi sì che non vi cape, 42 e fuor di sua natura in giù s’atterra,
43 la mente mia così, tra quelle dape 44 fatta più grande, di sé stessa uscìo, 45 e che si fesse rimembrar non sape.
query.result:
**English:**
40 As fire leaps from cloud to cloud, 41 spreading so that it cannot be contained, 42 and against its nature falls to earth,
43 so my mind, among those feasts, 44 grew larger and left itself behind, 45 and how it did so, it cannot recall.
**Sanskrit:**
40 Yathā nabhastalād nabhastalaṃ prati 41 agniḥ prastarate vistīrṇatām āpnoti 42 svabhāvato 'nyaṃ bhūmau patati,
43 tathā mama manaḥ tāsu bhojaneṣu 44 vistīrṇatām āpannam ātmanaḥ parataḥ pravṛttam, 45 katham caivam abhūt tad na jānāti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
46 «Apri li occhi e riguarda qual son io; 47 tu hai vedute cose, che possente 48 se’ fatto a sostener lo riso mio».
query.result:
**English:**
46 "Open your eyes and see who I am; 47 you have seen things that have made you strong enough 48 to endure my smile."
**Sanskrit:**
46 "Netrāṇi vivṛṇuṣva paśya ca ko 'ham asmi; 47 adya tvayā dṛṣṭāni tāni tāni 48 yebhyaḥ śaktaḥ samabhavasi mama hasitam sahitum."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
49 Io era come quei che si risente 50 di visïone oblita e che s’ingegna 51 indarno di ridurlasi a la mente,
52 quand’ io udi’ questa proferta, degna 53 di tanto grato, che mai non si stingue 54 del libro che ’l preterito rassegna.
query.result:
**English:**
49 I was like one who rouses himself 50 from a forgotten dream and tries in vain 51 to bring it back to mind,
52 when I heard this gracious offer, worthy 53 of such gratitude that it never fades 54 from the book that records the past.
**Sanskrit:**
49 Ahaṃ āsam iva yaḥ pratibudhyate 50 svapnāt viśṛtāt yatnate ca karoti 51 vyartham smṛtyartham punar ānayitum,
52 yadā aśrauṣam imām āśvāsanām, arhāṃ 53 tasyāḥ kṛtajñatāyāḥ yā kadācit na kṣīyate 54 pustakāt yasya pūrvaṃ paśyati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
55 Se mo sonasser tutte quelle lingue 56 che Polimnïa con le suore fero 57 del latte lor dolcissimo più pingue,
58 per aiutarmi, al millesmo del vero 59 non si verria, cantando il santo riso 60 e quanto il santo aspetto facea mero;
61 e così, figurando il paradiso, 62 convien saltar lo sacrato poema, 63 come chi trova suo cammin riciso.
query.result:
**English:**
55 If all those tongues were mine that Polyhymnia 56 made more copious with her sisters 57 from their sweetest milk,
58 they would not suffice to aid me, 59 not even to the thousandth part of the truth, 60 in singing of the holy laughter 61 and how much the holy aspect made me pure;
62 and thus, in picturing Paradise, 63 the sacred poem must leap, 64 like one who finds his way cut off.
**Sanskrit:**
55 Yadi tāḥ sarvā me bhāṣāḥ syuḥ 56 Yāḥ Polyhymnia bhagineyībhiḥ saha 57 Svīyena madhureṇa payasā pīvaratarāḥ kṛtāḥ,
58 Mama saṃrakṣaṇāya, satyasya sahasratamāṃśe 'pi 59 Na prāpyeta, pavitraṃ hasyam gāyataḥ 60 Evaṃ ca yathā pavitram rūpaṃ śuddham cakāra;
61 Evaṃ ca svargam varṇayataḥ 62 Pāvanam kāvyam atilaṅghanīyam eva, 63 Yathā yasya svayamārgaḥ chinnaḥ syāt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
64 Ma chi pensasse il ponderoso tema 65 e l’omero mortal che se ne carca, 66 nol biasmerebbe se sott’ esso trema:
67 non è pareggio da picciola barca 68 quel che fendendo va l’ardita prora, 69 né da nocchier ch’a sé medesmo parca.
query.result:
**English:**
64 But whoever would consider the weighty theme 65 and the mortal shoulder that bears it, 66 would not blame it if it trembles beneath it:
67 it is not a comparison for a small boat 68 that which the daring prow cleaves through, 69 nor for a pilot who spares himself.
**Sanskrit:**
64 Yadi tu kaścid vicintayet gurutaraṃ viṣayam 65 martyaṃ ca skandham yena sa bhāryate, 66 na nindayet tam yadi sa kampate tasya adhastāt:
67 na tulyaṃ laghu-nāvikayā 68 yat prāpya arditā prora gacchati, 69 na ca nausthinaḥ svayam eva kṛpaṇaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
70 «Perché la faccia mia sì t’innamora, 71 che tu non ti rivolgi al bel giardino 72 che sotto i raggi di Cristo s’infiora?
73 Quivi è la rosa in che ’l verbo divino 74 carne si fece; quivi son li gigli 75 al cui odor si prese il buon cammino».
query.result:
**English:**
70 "Why does my face so enamor you, 71 that you do not turn to the beautiful garden 72 that blossoms beneath the rays of Christ?
73 There is the rose in which the divine Word 74 became flesh; there are the lilies 75 whose fragrance led us to take the good path."
**Sanskrit:**
70 "Kimartham mama mukham evam tvām mohayati, 71 yataḥ tvam na pravṛttaḥ asi sundare udyāne 72 yaḥ Khristasya raśmibhiḥ puṣpavanto bhavati?
73 Tatrāsti sa rosaḥ yasmin daivī vāṇī 74 mānuṣī mūrtir abhavat; tatrāsti saḥ kumudaḥ 75 yasya gandhena śubhaḥ panthāḥ gṛhītaḥ."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
76 Così Beatrice; e io, che a’ suoi consigli 77 tutto era pronto, ancora mi rendei 78 a la battaglia de’ debili cigli.
query.result:
**English:**
76 Thus Beatrice; and I, who to her counsels 77 was wholly ready, yielded myself again 78 to the struggle of the feeble eyes.
**Sanskrit:**
76 Evamuvāca Beatrikā; aham tu tayā upadeśitena 77 sarvam āsīt prastutaḥ, punarapi adadām ātmānam 78 durbalānām netrāṇām yuddhe.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
85 O benigna vertù che sì li ’mprenti, 86 sù t’essaltasti, per largirmi loco 87 a li occhi lì che non t’eran possenti.
query.result:
**English:**
85 O benign power that dost so imprint them, 86 thou didst exalt thyself to give me place 87 beside those eyes that were not potent over thee.
**Sanskrit:**
85 He dayāluḥ śaktiḥ yā tathā tāṃ mudrayase, 86 Tvaṃ svayam uttamam sthānam prāpaḥ, 87 Tatra teṣu netreṣu ye tava prabhāvam na jānanti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
88 Il nome del bel fior ch’io sempre invoco 89 e mane e sera, tutto mi ristrinse 90 l’animo ad avvisar lo maggior foco;
91 e come ambo le luci mi dipinse 92 il quale e il quanto de la viva stella 93 che là sù vince come qua giù vinse,
94 per entro il cielo scese una facella, 95 formata in cerchio a guisa di corona, 96 e cinsela e girossi intorno ad ella.

Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
97 Qualunque melodia più dolce suona 98 qua giù e più a sé l’anima tira, 99 parrebbe nube che squarciata tona,
100 comparata al sonar di quella lira 101 onde si coronava il bel zaffiro 102 del quale il ciel più chiaro s’inzaffira.
query.result:
**English:**
97 Any melody that sounds sweetest here below 98 and draws the soul most to itself, 99 would seem a cloud torn asunder and thundering,
100 compared to the sound of that lyre 101 with which the fair sapphire was crowned, 102 with which the clearest heaven is adorned.
**Sanskrit:**
97 Yā kācid api madhuratara-dhvaniḥ śrūyate 98 iha adhastāt, yā ca ātmānam adhikaṁ ākarṣati, 99 sā abhra iva bhinnaṁ garjanti dṛśyeta,
100 tulya-kṛtā tena vīṇā-dhvaninā, 101 yena śobhanam nīla-maṇiḥ mūrdhni-bhūṣaṇaṁ kṛtaḥ āsīt, 102 yena ca śubhra-tamam nabhaḥ nīla-maṇi-mayaṁ kṛtaṁ bhāti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
109 Così la circulata melodia 110 si sigillava, e tutti li altri lumi 111 facean sonare il nome di Maria.
query.result:
**English:**
109 Thus the circling melody 110 was sealed, and all the other lights 111 made the name of Mary resound.
**Sanskrit:**
109 Evam paribhramaṇarūpā gītiḥ 110 samāpyate sma, anye ca sarve prakāśāḥ 111 Mārīyākhyaṃ nāma dhvanayanti sma.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
112 Lo real manto di tutti i volumi 113 del mondo, che più ferve e più s’avviva 114 ne l’alito di Dio e nei costumi,
115 avea sopra di noi l’interna riva 116 tanto distante, che la sua parvenza, 117 là dov’ io era, ancor non appariva:
118 però non ebber li occhi miei potenza 119 di seguitar la coronata fiamma 120 che si levò appresso sua semenza.
query.result:
**English:**
112 The royal mantle of all volumes 113 of the world, which most burns and most enlivens 114 in the breath of God and in customs,
115 had above us the inner shore 116 so distant, that its appearance, 117 where I was, still did not appear:
118 therefore my eyes did not have the power 119 to follow the crowned flame 120 that rose after its seed.
**Sanskrit:**
112 Sarveṣāṃ granthānāṃ rājyaṃ vastram 113 jagataḥ, yat adhikaṃ tapati adhikaṃ ca jīvati 114 deveśasya prāṇeṣu ācāreṣu ca,
115 asmābhiḥ upari antarataṭaḥ āsīt 116 tiryak tiryak, yataḥ tasya rūpaṃ, 117 yatra aham āsmi, adyāpi na abhāsat:
118 atas na me cakṣuṣoḥ śaktiḥ āsīt 119 mūrdhni sthitāṃ jvālāṃ anugantum 120 yā tasya bījasya paścāt udabhūt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
127 Indi rimaser lì nel mio cospetto, 128 ‘Regina celi’ cantando sì dolce, 129 che mai da me non si partì ’l diletto.
query.result:
**English:**
127 Then she remained there before me, 128 singing ‘Regina celi’ so sweetly, 129 that the delight never departed from me.
**Sanskrit:**
127 Tataḥ sā tatra sthitā āsīt mama agre, 128 ‘Regina celi’ gāyantī tathā mṛdu, 129 yataḥ ānandaḥ mama na kadācit prāyāt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
130 Oh quanta è l’ubertà che si soffolce 131 in quelle arche ricchissime che fuoro 132 a seminar qua giù buone bobolce!
133 Quivi si vive e gode del tesoro 134 che s’acquistò piangendo ne lo essilio 135 di Babillòn, ove si lasciò l’oro.
query.result:
**English:**
130 Oh, how great is the abundance that is sown 131 in those most rich arks that were 132 to sow good seeds down here!
133 Here one lives and enjoys the treasure 134 that was acquired with weeping in the exile 135 of Babylon, where gold was left behind.
**Sanskrit:**
130 Aha, katham ubertā yā svayam pūryate 131 tāsu arkeṣu ativittapūrṇeṣu yāḥ āsīt 132 atra bhūmau śubhān bījāni vapitum!
133 Atra jīvyate sukham anubhūyate ca nidhiḥ 134 yaḥ prāptaḥ āsīt rudan Babilonasya vanavāsakāle 135 yatra hiraṇyam parityaktam āsīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
136 Quivi trïunfa, sotto l’alto Filio 137 di Dio e di Maria, di sua vittoria, 138 e con l’antico e col novo concilio,
139 colui che tien le chiavi di tal gloria.
query.result:
**English:**
136 Here triumphs, under the high Son 137 of God and Mary, his victory, 138 and with the old and the new council,
139 he who holds the keys to such glory.
**Sanskrit:**
136 Atra vijayate uttamaḥ Putraḥ 137 Devasya ca Māriyāyāśca, tasya vijayaḥ, 138 pūrva-nava-sabhāyā saha,
139 yaḥ dhārayati kīṃ tasya yaśasaḥ.
